question:
A company needs to retain application log files for a critical application for 10 years. The application team regularly accesses logs from the past month for troubleshooting but logs older than 1 month are rarely accessed. The application generates more than 10 TB of logs per month.

Which storage option meets these requirements MOST cost-effectively?

options.A: Store the logs in Amazon S3. Use AWS Backup to move logs more than 1 month old to S3 Glacier Deep Archive.
options.B: Store the logs in Amazon S3. Use S3 Lifecycle policies to move logs more than 1 month old to S3 Glacier Deep Archive.
options.C: Store the logs in Amazon CloudWatch Logs. Use AWS Backup to move logs more than 1 month old to S3 Glacier Deep Archive.
options.D: Store the logs in Amazon CloudWatch Logs. Use Amazon S3 Lifecycle policies to move logs more than 1 month old to S3 Glacier Deep Archive.

explanation: S3 with Lifecycle policies to transition to Glacier Deep Archive after 1 month is the most cost-effective solution for long-term log retention. S3 handles the 10 TB/month volume efficiently. Deep Archive is the cheapest storage for rarely accessed data. CloudWatch Logs is more expensive at this scale. AWS Backup doesn't transition S3 objects to Glacier tiers.
